body:
Comment 6 by **adioso**: 
I ran into this problem too and I'd like to try to help. The HTML5 tree construction
specs for the starting script tag

http://dev.w3.org/html5/spec/tree-construction.html#scriptTag

state that the last step is to switch the insertion mode to text. The text insertion mode

http://dev.w3.org/html5/spec/tree-construction.html#parsing-main-incdata

recognizes character tokens, end-of-file tokens, script end tags, and any other end tag.
So it seems to me that </script> will end the script no matter where it is
located, even if it is in a comment or quoted string. I tested this out on
http://validator.w3.org/check using the direct input mode and indeed, a </script>
in a comment or quoted string ended the script.

Here are the examples I tested:

This tests OK:

<!doctype html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
  <meta charset="utf-8">
  <title>The HTML5 Demo</title>
  <meta name="description" content="The HTML5 demo">
  <meta name="author" content="demo">
  <script type="text/javascript">
    alert("foo");
  </script>
</head>
<body>
</body>
</html>

This fails with "Line 10, Column 11: Stray end tag script" and additional errors:

<!doctype html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
  <meta charset="utf-8">
  <title>The HTML5 Demo</title>
  <meta name="description" content="The HTML5 demo">
  <meta name="author" content="demo">
  <script type="text/javascript">
    alert("</script>");
  </script>
</head>
<body>
</body>
</html>

This fails with "Line 11, Column 11: Stray end tag script" as the only error:

<!doctype html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
  <meta charset="utf-8">
  <title>The HTML5 Demo</title>
  <meta name="description" content="The HTML5 demo">
  <meta name="author" content="demo">
  <script type="text/javascript">
    alert("foo");
  //</script>
  </script>
</head>
<body>
</body>
</html>
